name: savr
description: Read it later. Keep it local. No server needed.
readme_summary: Savr is a progressive web app (PWA) for saving online content to read later, emphasizing offline access and user data control. It functions as a 'read it later' service that allows users to save articles and other online content for offline viewing, removing distractions like advertisements. Savr can be used as a hosted service or self-hosted, and it supports optional authorization and cross-device synchronization via Dropbox or Google Drive.
key_features: No dependency on a service/company for scraping or storage
Optional authorization and cross device synchronization
primary_use_case: Saving online content for offline reading and later access.
cover_image_prompt: A librarian meticulously archiving digital scrolls into a personal vault. The librarian carefully places each scroll, representing an article, into the vault, which glows with a soft, internal light, symbolizing offline availability. Small UI elements showing a simplified browser interface are subtly integrated into the vault's design. The scene is set in a cozy, futuristic library with warm lighting. Digital particles float around the librarian, representing data being securely stored. The composition is clean and focused, with a color scheme of blues and golds. The image should be in 3D isometric illustration style with rich details and vibrant colors.

name: s3sync
description: Really fast sync tool for S3
readme_summary: S3Sync is a Go-based tool designed for high-speed synchronization of files to and from S3-compatible storage. It supports multi-threaded uploading/downloading and offers flexible filtering options, making it suitable for managing large numbers of small files. It can sync between S3 and local filesystems, or directly between S3 buckets.
primary_use_case: Synchronizing large numbers of small files to and from S3-compatible storage with high speed and efficiency.
cover_image_prompt: A team of swift messengers, each carrying data packets represented as glowing orbs, converging on a central cloud-shaped hub labeled 'S3'. Some messengers are arriving from a local filing cabinet, others from another cloud. The messengers are depicted with trails of light, indicating speed. Small UI elements showing progress bars and file names float around the cloud. The scene is set in a bright, modern office environment with subtle server racks in the background. The repository name, 'S3Sync', is subtly displayed on a banner. The image should be in a flat design style with clear iconography and a vibrant color scheme.

name: RustedLessPass
description: Compatible with LessPass. RustedLessPass is a standalone password manager written in Rust. Powered by Rust / Wasm.
readme_summary: RustedLessPass is a standalone password manager written in Rust and WebAssembly, compatible with LessPass. It allows users to generate and manage passwords securely without server-side dependencies, offering a platform-independent solution accessible through any modern web browser.
primary_use_case: Securely generating and managing passwords without needing to remember individual passwords for each site.
cover_image_prompt: A blacksmith in a futuristic forge, crafting unique keys for different glowing doors. The blacksmith uses a master key blueprint and specific website details as input, forging a new key for each door. Digital interfaces display password generation algorithms and security metrics. The forge is filled with sparks and glowing digital particles. Small screens show the RustedLessPass logo and UI elements. The scene is set in a clean, modern workshop with dramatic lighting. The composition is focused and clear, highlighting the key-making process. The image should be in 3D isometric illustration style with vibrant colors and rich details.

name: dockrtui
description: A fast, modern and keyboard-driven terminal dashboard for Docker â€” built with Rust and Ratatui
readme_summary: DockrTUI is a terminal dashboard for Docker, built with Rust and Ratatui, designed for managing containers, images, networks, volumes, and Compose projects. It provides a keyboard-driven interface for quick actions like starting, stopping, restarting, and inspecting Docker resources, aiming to simplify Docker management.
key_features: Containers, Images, Networks, Volumes & Compose management
Quick actions (start, stop, restart, inspect, prune)
Clean, efficient TUI powered by ratatui
primary_use_case: Managing Docker containers, images, networks, volumes, and Compose projects through a terminal-based user interface.
cover_image_prompt: A seasoned ship captain at the helm of a futuristic vessel, navigating a sea of containers, images, and networks displayed as holographic projections. The captain uses a keyboard to issue commands, instantly managing the flow of resources. The ship's bridge is filled with glowing data streams and subtle UI elements showing Docker statistics. The repository name, 'DockrTUI,' is subtly displayed on the ship's navigation console. The scene is set in a brightly lit, modern control room. The image should be in a 3D isometric illustration style with rich details and vibrant colors.

name: pipedash
description: A desktop app for managing CI/CD pipelines from multiple providers
readme_summary: Pipedash is a desktop application designed to aggregate and manage CI/CD pipelines from multiple providers like GitHub Actions, GitLab CI, Buildkite, Jenkins, Tekton CD, and ArgoCD into a single interface. It allows users to view pipeline statuses, browse run history, trigger workflows, and manage builds across different platforms from one central location.
key_features: View pipeline status across multiple providers
Browse run history with commit info and execution times
Trigger workflows with parameters dynamically loaded from each provider
Re-run previous executions with the same parameters
Support for multiple instances of the same provider type
Privacy-focused: everything runs locally, data stored in SQLite, tokens encrypted
primary_use_case: Centralized management and monitoring of CI/CD pipelines from multiple providers.
cover_image_prompt: A control room operator sits before a large, central console displaying interconnected pipelines flowing from various sources (GitHub, GitLab, Jenkins) into a unified dashboard. The operator monitors the flow, represented by glowing streams of data, ensuring smooth delivery. Small screens around the console show UI elements of Pipedash. The scene is set in a modern, minimalist control room with cool, futuristic lighting. Digital particles highlight the data flow. The composition is focused and clean, with a blue and green color scheme. The image should be in a 3D isometric illustration style with rich details and vibrant colors.

name: lazyssh
description: A terminal-based SSH manager inspired by lazydocker and k9s - Written in go
readme_summary: Lazyssh is a terminal-based SSH manager that simplifies server management by providing an interactive UI for connecting to servers defined in the user's `~/.ssh/config` file. It allows users to quickly navigate, connect, manage, and transfer files between their local machine and servers, eliminating the need to remember IP addresses or run long scp commands.
key_features: Server Management (add, edit, delete, pin, ping)
Quick Server Navigation (fuzzy search, one-keypress SSH, tagging, sorting)
Advanced SSH Configuration (port forwarding, connection multiplexing, advanced authentication, security settings, proxy settings)
Key Management (SSH key autocomplete, smart key selection)
primary_use_case: Managing SSH connections and configurations through a terminal-based UI.
cover_image_prompt: A librarian in a high-tech library is organizing glowing server racks using a keyboard as a control panel. The librarian swiftly connects cables representing SSH tunnels between the racks, guided by a holographic display showing server aliases and tags. Digital particles flow from the keyboard to the racks, visualizing the connections. Small UI elements on the racks display SSH configurations. The scene is set in a clean, futuristic library with soft, blue lighting. The composition is focused and clear, with a balanced color scheme. The image should be in a 3D isometric illustration style with rich details and vibrant colors.
